lines.text: Deals come and go. Wellman will always be Wellman. But you know what bothers me? I walking down the street and this 8-year old boy says, Look Mommy, there's the Hamster's BITCH!
Buddy Love, I am SICK, and TIRED, of your S-H...
I.
Thank you. T-E!
Oh, ho-ho-ho. My shite?
[Sherman is serenading Denise with the assistance of a crap Mexican band]
Denise will you...
Hey Sherman. You hear me Sherman?
...Denise will ya? Will ya? Let me come up there and put my beef in your taco?

[singing]
Put his beef in your taco!
What?

[Buddy cackles, Sherman's conscious comes back]
Oh, no! No, no, no...
[chuckles]
That's not what I meant to say, Denise! That was just a little joke! I just wanted to see if you wanted to go out and get some Mexican food. That's why I said that.
Well I am kind of hungry, but I'm not-...
Yeah, you are huh? Yeah, I bet you could stand for a big ol' whopper right now, huh?

[singing]
A big ole whopper right now!
You're sick!
Yeah, I got to tell you, I'm a Jumbo Jack man myself, if you know what I mean. Yeah and I'm loaded with secret sauce! Yeah, come on!
[Sherman does a perverted dance in front of a shocked Denise, and falls to the ground, sexually humping it]
Bang that thing up! Yeah, come on! Come on! Make it funky!
You're gonna ruin my lawn, you pervert!
You better eat up Isaac, 'cause you gonna need your strength. Yeah, later on, me and Isaac gonna watch "Mating Season on the Serengeti." Doesn't take a lot to get Isaac going
Timeout! Let me call a timeout on that
Lord, my, my.
I don't want to hear about you old-ass geriatrics.
Oh, yeah Cletus? Me and Isaac might be dried up geriatrics, but ain't nothing wrong with Isaac'a love tackle.
[Table falls silent]
Oh snap, now.
What's a matter Cletus, cat got your tongue? Did I step on a nerve Cletus? I get ya, got ya, got ya!
Hey Cletus, who dat der piece of bisghetti remind you of? Maybe Mr. Johnson perhaps?
Come on Cletus, come on right now! But I'm gonna tell you something, I gotta a razor in this here bag.
Oh yeah? Well let me tell you something, that ain't even no bag you got in your hand, that's your titty.
Cletus!
She's an old bag with old bag tittie.

[quietly to Ernie Jr]
Heh, he called Grandma a titty bag.
[Isaac, Granny's boyfriend, walks to the dinner table]
Well, if it isn't the world's oldest living Negro! Hey how's things going on the Underground Railroad, Isaac?

The other day I got out the shower and I bend down to reach for a towel, and I felt a sharp pain in my chest. Shot through my chest and up around my shoulder and down my spine. I thought "Oh, Lord." I thought I was dying. I bent over and looked, and I was standing on my own titty.
You don't need a breast reduction, just be more careful.
Both feet, too. Both feet.
Does Cletus know I'm strapped?
Come on, shoot.
I'm strapped, nigga!
[the chorus just finished singing 'Happy Day']
Happy day, happy day, happy day, my ass.

[Answering door]
Oh my, goodness! Is there a fire?
Yes ma'am. I'm afraid there is.
I don't smell no smoke.
[sniffs]

[Walks in and beings playing music from stereo]
There's a fire in my pants, and it's getting muy caliente!
[begins stripping]
Ooh!
[laugh and clap]
Ooh! Lord, have mercy! A strip - Oh, my! My mother must've arranged this!
What *I* do in *my* bedroom is *MY* business, you understand that?
The only thing you do in your bedroom is pull the lint off your scrotum!
Now that's what I call the Muy Caliente El Negro Special!
Viagra don't work for me. I've been taking 'em like M&Ms.
What's wrong with you, woman? Don't you wanna be young?

No, Cletus, I don't wanna be young! Cletus, we supposed to be who we are and I'm just fine with who I am! But obviously, what you're trying to say is that you're just TIRED of the fat old woman that you got married to!
Oh no, Anna, that's not what I'm saying! That's ain't what I'm saying at all, Anna - !

[sobbing]
Downstairs!
Anna, please! Don't baby, I'm just trying to - !
I think you better sleep downstairs, Cletus!
But I...!
Downstairs, Cletus! I don't want to hear it!
[sobs]
Oh, Cletus, I'm so disappointed in you!

You wanna know what's permanent, Sherman? You know what's permanent? I'll tell you. What me and your momma got. That's permanent. That ain't going no place. You know what I mean? I'll tell you, boy, if you find you a woman that loves you, that really really loves you, you gotta hold onto that Sherman.
Yeah, it's true, Daddy. Yeah, I know I sure do love Denise.
Well, then y'all gotta get back together then!
Get back together... Daddy, that's it! Get back together!
Yeah! That's right!
If we get back together, then that'll make everything okay!
Dynamite! Go and call the girl!
No, not Denise, I'm talking about Buddy!
Say what?
If me and Buddy get back together, that'll make everything fine between me and Denise!
Hey, you just took the wrong off-ramp!
I can use the youth formula. I'll feed it to Buddy. It'll make him so young. I'll turn him back into Goop. And I ingest it... I eat it! I eat it!
Huh? Say what now?
That's it! Daddy, that'll work! I wouldn't have even thought about that. This is fantastic!
[leaves]
What are you gonna eat? Sherman!
Not so fast, pal. I'm not letting you out of my sight until both our names are on that contract. I'm gonna be stuck to you like a giant hampster on my a -... Where you go, I go.
Well if it isn't the creator of Jumbo the Horny Hampster!
PLEASE!
You're losing your intelligence, sir.
Yeah, I know. I can't even beat Molly and she's the dumbest hampster we got!
Professor? You okay?
Yeah. I just don't wanna hurt her, Jason.
Then you won't. Hey, you CAN control Buddy.

You know it's funny how you get used to certain things in life. You get used to being overweight. I know I did. You even get used to people making fun of you. Somewhere along the line, I got used to being alone. And I just don't want to be alone anymore.
Sherman you're very special to me.

[laughs, embarrassed and flattered]
I didn't think you and I would ever, you know... How can I put it? 'Cos I'm...
Big.
Yeah, I was gonna say 'fat,' but 'big' is better.

Sherman, that doesn't matter to me. What matters to me is that you're kind and decent. You are the most brilliant man I've ever known. And speaking of which, I shouldn't keep you from your research, so I'll catch up with you later?
Okay, I'll see you soon.
[she leaves]

[to himself]
My goodness.
So that's where Sherman's hiding the formula. Klumpville. Chunky town. Big-ass city! Heh heh heh!
Would you *please* put your clothes back on? You look like a roast chicken!

[to Denise]
I just want to say I'm sorry. I never... never wanted to hurt you. Understand? I thought that if you knew Buddy was a part of me, I thought that you wouldn't have me then.
Sherman...
Hear me out... I should've had more faith in you. Should've had more faith in myself. But I...
Sherman? Sherman, what's wrong? Sherman!
C'mon, can't you hear, son?

[persistent]
Sherman, look at me! Who am I?

[without memory]
Pretty lady!

[sobbing]
Oh, honey!
[hugs Sherman]
It's going to be okay, I'll take care of you.

[gleefully, at same time]
Oh, that's nice! Nice.
Come on, let's get the boy home.
Nice lady!
Cletus, have you ever heard of the expression 'mercy hump'?
Say what?
[Chantel laughs loudly]
'Cause that's what you've been getting all these years - mercy humps.
Mama, don't start! Stop it!
You outta your goddamn mind. Let me tell you something...

[laughs]
He ain't got nothin' but a limp doodle!
[Anna gasps as Cletus grows offended, Chantel stops laughing]
Oops, sorry.

[to Cletus, laughs]
God'll getcha!
Clesius!
[to Chantal and Grandma]
Oh, look what you've done! Oh.
You girls are crazy. I'm leaving. I don't believe it.
[storms out]
Oh, Clesius, Clesius, wait! Clesius! Oh, Clesius! Cletus, I only told her 'cause she's got so much experience in sexual matters.
'my husband ain't nothin' but a big ol' pile of worthless crap'!
[Cletus leaves]

[sadly]
Cletus! Cletus! Oh!

[to Sherman]
Pervert! 'Beef in your taco'!
Sherman Klump. Well, you still eat those happy meals, you haven't changed a bit. You remember me, it's Buddy Love, we both used to chase that girl Carla at the same time.
Miss Purty and I were just friends.
Just friends, huh?
[Looks at Denise]
Well, who's your new friend? Oh you're fine. What's your name?

[his last words, climbs a fountain as he is dying]
Alright, tubby... let's see how long you last... without me...
[he evaporates on the side]
[Sherman and Dean look at what's left of Buddy by the fountain]
What - that's it? He's gone?
[Sherman stutters at a loss for words]
Ba-ba-ba-ba-ba-what? Oh, that's marvelous!
[Sherman continues as they sit by the fountain]
The deal is dead you know that. I've been calling you a moron for years, now you're finally...
[he stops realizing he said enough]

[leaves]
I'll just get a cab.
If I want to put a trumpet in my ass and run around this restaurant and blow, then "Hallelujah!Yankee Doodle!" that's my business!

[to Ernie Jr. who just belched in a restaurant]
Hey, look, your grandpa ate a whole plate of beans before we came down here, you don't see me sitting here doing the old butt trumpet, do you?
Um, sir, if it makes you feel any better, Petey is back to normal and feeling just fine.
Oh yeah? D'YOU THINK HE'LL CALL?
Dean, I just want to tell you, I'm - I'm sorry...
STOP... SPEAKING!
I just want to go on record as saying that -
[muttering]
You're FAT!
[chuckles]
And dumb...!
[Denise enters the room]
...and fired.
[Dean Richmond leaves]

[after Denise finds out about Buddy Love]
What's going on with you, Sherman and Buddy, some kind of menage a trois or something?
